question.text: The vascular cambium of dicot root originates from the

options.text: tissue located just below the phloem bundles & a portion of pericycle tissue.
tissue located just below the xylem bundles & a portion of pericycle tissue.
tissue located just below the xylem bundles & a portion of endodermis tissue.
tissue located just below the phloem bundles & a portion of endodermis tissue.

solution.text: The vascular cambium is a lateral meristem in the vascular tissue of plants. It is a cylinder of unspecialized meristem cells that divide to give rise to cells that further divide, differentiate and specialize to form the secondary vascular tissues. Vascular cambium of dicot root originates from the tissue located just below the phloem bundles & a portion of pericycle tissue.
